transcript.speaker: Judge
transcript.text: This court is now in session. Counsel for the petitioner, you may begin your opening statement.

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: Thank you, Your Honor. May it please the court, this case concerns the fundamental Fifth Amendment right against self-incrimination.

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: The facts are clear: Mr. Miranda was subjected to custodial interrogation without being informed of his constitutional rights.

transcript.speaker: Judge
transcript.text: Counsel, what specific warnings do you propose should be required?

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: Your Honor, at minimum, suspects must be informed of their right to remain silent and their right to counsel.

transcript.speaker: Respondent
transcript.text: Objection, Your Honor. Counsel is testifying rather than arguing.

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: The coercive nature of custodial interrogation creates an inherently intimidating atmosphere that requires procedural safeguards.

strengths: Strong opening statement with clear thesis
improvements: Could provide more specific case citations

transcript.speaker: Judge
transcript.text: Counsel for respondent, please present your argument.

transcript.speaker: Respondent
transcript.text: Your Honor, while we acknowledge the importance of equal protection, the state has made substantial efforts to equalize facilities.

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: Objection! Counsel is misstating the facts. The facilities are demonstrably unequal.

transcript.speaker: Judge
transcript.text: Sustained. Counsel, please stick to the record.

transcript.speaker: Respondent
transcript.text: My apologies, Your Honor. The record shows significant investment in improving separate facilities.

transcript.speaker: Judge
transcript.text: Good afternoon. Counsel for petitioner, you may proceed.

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: Thank you, Your Honor. This case asks the court to recognize a duty of care owed by manufacturers to ultimate consumers.

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: The traditional privity requirement creates an unjust barrier to recovery for those harmed by negligent manufacturing.

transcript.speaker: Judge
transcript.text: Counsel, how do you respond to the floodgates argument?

transcript.speaker: Petitioner
transcript.text: Your Honor, the duty is limited by the concept of reasonable foreseeability. Not every injury will give rise to liability.

improvements: Could elaborate more on limiting principles
Add more factual detail to strengthen narrative
Present more arguments to strengthen your case
